channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: What Tarique Rahman’s return to Bangladesh means for India
Why did Trump order strikes on Islamic State targets in Nigeria?
Meet Jebu, Tarique Rahman’s Siberian cat who stole the spotlight after arriving in Bangladesh
Who was Shivank Avasthi, the Indian student shot dead near Toronto University campus?
Dipu Chandra Das and Amrit Mondal: The tale of 2 lynchings in Bangladesh
History Today: How the Indian Ocean tsunami wiped out communities from the world map
How Chile confirms the global phenomenon of the rise of right in 2025
item.description: The Chilean presidential election aligns with a broader right-wing shift across the region — most recently seen in Bolivia — reversing the 'pink tide' of left-leaning governments over the past two decades

item.title: Silent guardians beneath the sea: How India’s K-4 missile completed the nuclear triad
item.description: The nuclear triad, once a distant ambition, is now a reality—making India safer, stronger, and more secure on the world stage

item.title: Why Dhaka’s rhetoric softened after the Army Chiefs spoke
item.description: For India, the conversation reinforces a time-tested approach: engage institutions, ignore theatrics, trust professionalism. For Bangladesh, it was an opportunity to let its strongest assets, its disciplined military leadership and capable diplomatic cadre, speak through action rather than amplification

item.title: Opinion | Powerplay in Kathmandu: Nepal’s politics set to intensify as March polls approach
item.description: The March elections are expected to witness intense competition among various domestic and foreign groups seeking power and influence in Nepal

item.title: Munir’s ‘magic’: Why there is no protest in Pakistan on Gaza troop move
item.description: If there are no protests or large outpourings of rage in Pakistan, it will prove on the ground that all of them have, at all times, been paid lackeys of the army.

item.title: Bangladesh at the brink: How Islamist extremism threatens the nation’s Bengali soul
item.description: Bangladesh is approaching a point of no return. When cultural institutions burn, minorities are lynched, and jihadist flags fly unchallenged, the issue is no longer domestic instability—it is civilisational survival
